results.title: Looking at Britain: trainers in training
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description: Training athletic coaches. To make sure there will always be enough expert instruction for the youth of Britain there are several colleges where future instructors are trained. One college is Loughborough. Here teachers of physical education are taught the techniques of different sports, learning not only to be good athletes themselves but how to pass their knowledge on to others.

results.title: Looking at Britain: British press
results.brief_description: Fleet Street is the home of three-quarters of England’s major newspapers, 16 million of which are printed every day. Shows how a newspaper gathers its news, the various functions of its staff, printing, despatch and distribution.

results.title: Look to your hands
results.brief_description: Discusses the importance of hands to the individual and the abuses they suffer, particularly in industry. Describes the three main layers of the skin, the epidermis, dermis and subcutaneous, and their functions. Shows the process of infection through hair follicles and precautions and cures in combating bacteria.

results.title: Look luv, you're in for a few shocks!
results.brief_description: Two years prior to the making of this documentary film, the Gordon family migrated from Great Britain to Australia. In the film titled “If we don’t go, we’ll never know, will we?” (Title Code 503633), the ABC’s “Chequerboard” series looked at the family before they migrated and at their arrival and settline-in period in Australia. In this film, we now take a look at the family after nearly two years in the country. Do theyknow now? Has their dream of Australia been realised? In fact, did they make the right decision? The film tries to find the answers. Reported by Richard Oxenburgh.

results.title: Long Shadows the Legacy of the American Civil War
results.brief_description: A documentary examining the legacy of the American Civil War and its effect upon the politics and people of the south in the 1980s. Interviews with Robert Penn Warren, Studs Terkel, Jimmy Carter and others.

results.title: London terminus
results.brief_description: From London a vast national railway system radiates: at the railway terminus in London, 1,704 trains enter and leave the station every day. Millions of urban workers depend entirely on the railway system for their daily transport to and from central London, and, in addition, there are many expresses and goods trains which span the length and breadth of Great Britain. Music composed by Horace Somerville, played by London Symphony Orchestra under Muir Mathieson.
